newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan buys $4.87 bln European auto parts in 95/96.
newsitem.headline: Japan buys $4.87 bln European auto parts in 95/96.

text.p: The Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association (JAMA) said on Friday that purchases of European-made car parts and materials by Japanese carmakers totalled $4.87 billion in the year ended March 31, 1996.
JAMA has no year-before comparision because this is the first time for the Japanese auto industry has disclosed the figure.
The total comprised $4.09 billion worth of components and materials for use at Japanese makers' European units, and $783.37 million of imports into Japan.

In July, JAMA said Japan bought a record $21.03 billion worth of American-made car parts and materials in 1995/96 for use at Japanese carmakers' units in the United States and for use at Japanese plants, up from the previous record $19.86 billion in 1994/95.
